intro: Styloglossum formosanum var. actinomorphum, commonly known as the Taiwan styloglossum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has a short, woody stem and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
